citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
The facility did not treat four limping adult goats (#871, 841, 825, and 801). Medical records indicated that the animals
were limping and the Attending veterinarian wrote on 8/7/2025 to treat the animals with Zactran or Draxxin and Banamine.
A facility representative stated that these treatments were not performed. All animals still currently at the facility were not
observed to be limping. Failure to treat problems of animal health can lead to delays in providing proper care to animals
resulting in worsening of their condition. Each research facility must establish and maintain programs of adequate
veterinary care that include the use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries.
Correct by ensuring that that all animals receive adequate veterinary care at all times. Correct by 20-AUG-2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Eric Irvin, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.33(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
The facility did not treat four limping adult goats (#871, 841, 825, and 801). Medical records indicated that the animals 
were limping and the Attending veterinarian wrote on 8/7/2025 to treat the animals with Zactran or Draxxin and Banamine. 
A facility representative stated that these treatments were not performed. All animals still currently at the facility were not 
observed to be limping. Failure to treat problems of animal health can lead to delays in providing proper care to animals 
resulting in worsening of their condition. Each research facility must establish and maintain programs of adequate 
veterinary care that include the use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. 
Correct by ensuring that that all animals receive adequate veterinary care at all times. Correct by 20-AUG-2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Eric Irvin, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
